website_summaries.verdict: It’s not the best choice for full-body support, but it’s perfect for supporting the belly and legs while using a regular head pillow.
pros: A compact pillow that can be used in a variety of ways to relieve pregnancy aches and pains
cons: Not large enough to support the head/neck, belly, back, and legs/knees at the same time, so you have to choose which areas need support the most

customer_reviews.title: which is great if you have a smaller bed or have a ...
customer_reviews.text: Pro's: It's smaller than the regular size, which is great if you have a smaller bed or have a little toddler who sleeps in your bed. Easy to wash pillow case and replace After pregnancy useful as a bobby like nursing pillow Cons Compared to the full size, I originally thought it was not as comfortable. But this baby was a very large baby and caused more back pain/hip pain than my others. So, it's hard to really know if the comfort was actually less or if it was the fact I had a giant baby in me.
customer_reviews.author: Bb

customer_reviews.title: Good for back sleepers
customer_reviews.text: I went back and forth about whether or I needed it but after finally getting it i am so glad. I was always a back sleeper so this kept me sleeping comfortably on my side. Pillows never worked for me. I picked the mini because it is cheaper and a better fit sharing a queen bed with my husband and dog. It's not big enough for me (5'8") to have under my head and between my knees but that was ok with me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and cozy as a toddler pillow
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 3 year old (who consistently falls asleep in my Snoogle) to help her feel comfortable and close at night. She loves it. She calls it her nest, and it is the perfect size for her. Snoogle makes a junior version with animal covers, but I thought this would last a little longer with the amount of washes a toddler pillow would require. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: amllentil2

customer_reviews.title: Great size and good comfort
customer_reviews.text: It’s takes a few tries to get down exactly how you want to sleep with this but once you do it’s great. I love that it’s not huge and doesn’t take up the whole bed. It’s just the right amount of fluf for between my legs. You can curl it around itself and lay in your belly for a bit if you are really kissing that. I suspect it will also work well for nursing as it’s pretty easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product.
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this review on my husbands account that we share. I used this during my pregnancy and it helped me to fall asleep quickly and stay there. Even though I am not pregnant anymore I still use this pillow during the night and I just can't seem to get over how well it works. The cover that comes with it is troublesome to get back on but is a nice tight fit so you can't complain too much there. Overall I definitely recommend this product especially to those women who are just getting that baby bump and you can not find a comfortable position no matter what you do.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Great as a nursing pillow!
customer_reviews.text: I used this pillow for pregnancy with my first child but later transitioned it to a nursing pillow. It’s unique design and flexibility make it excellent for this second purpose. In fact, I think it’s *better* marketed for nursing. I just bought a second one for my second child to nurse (old one also still in use).
customer_reviews.author: meculp

customer_reviews.title: Still pretty large for "compact", does as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Transcribed from my wife talking: This pillow does the job mostly as expected. At some point, I still end up on my back and have to be rolled over. It's much more comfy using it in a way where you still keep your head on your own pillow instead of this one. Even though this is the compact sleeper, it's still relatively large for someone who is only 5'3". I'm certainly glad I didn't get the full-sized one! The main downside is that it is very difficult to roll over in the night, but I suppose that was to be expected :) Overall, a great buy. Much better than propping myself up with 5 pillows!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for me at 5'2" !
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'2" and this works perfectly for my second pregnancy. I had borrowed my friends regular sized one of these for my first pregnancy and it was too big. So I am excited they made the smaller version for smaller people. Very happy and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe and Sarah

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: Didn't provide as much comfort as I needed and I frankly found it difficult to stay in 1 position all night long in order to stay in it. It was quite difficult to get situated in it to begin with and as an unwieldy pregnant person it was just too much work. Won't be returning it because my baby can make use of it, but I didn't sleep in it more than 2 or 3 times.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this pillow
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this pillow, this is my first pregnancy so I waited a while to order a body pillow as I did not know if I would actually need one. I received it when I was around 4 months pregnant and I am obsessed. I cant sleep without it now! I debated between this mini pillow or the regular pillow, I am 5'2" and was 115 pre-pregnancy and this is the perfect size! Highly recommend for any expecting mothers out there! I also love that it can be used as a nursing pillow once the little one arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary Durso

customer_reviews.title: excellent pillow!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderfully priced pregnancy pillow! It is very easy to get comfortable with, and great for back sleepers, as it can be used to give extra back support. It can be turned into an "O" shape, allowing for third tri mom's to lay on their stomachs and get a massage. The "O" shape can also be used as a pillow to sit on for postpartum healing. The covers seemed a tad pricey to me, so I just took a large strip of material and sewed two lines, creating a long narrow pillow case- for free! It comes off easily enough (although I'm sure a zippered one would work better) and washes just fine.
customer_reviews.author: H. R. L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the petite pregnant person.
customer_reviews.text: I loved my snoogle! I got the mini because my husband and I sleep in a full size bed and there isn't a ton of room. This worked great. I'm also petite, 4'10" so I really didn't need the bigger size. If you're petite and pregnant this is a great option. I will say that it is a pain to get the cover back on when you wash it.
customer_reviews.author: Kitsey Burns Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Pillow Beyond Pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: I got this pillow over 4 years ago while pregnant. I chose this as I didn’t need a pillow for my head just everywhere else. I usually sleep with a pillow between my legs so this was perfect. 4 years later and not pregnant and I still use this pillow. It goes everywhere with me. I am coming back to order a new one since my current one has broken down from daily use.
customer_reviews.author: KEB

customer_reviews.title: I didn't give it 5 stars because it is on the small side for the price and quality and it came in a torn package so the cover wa
customer_reviews.text: I'm a petite woman (5'1) so it works well for me. I didn't get the big version because I didn't want it to take over the entire bed. I use another pillow between my knees and I've been sleeping very well. The quality is fair. It is made of polyester filling so it has a bouncy plastic feel. I won't be keeping it past my pregnancy needs. The cover washes well and putting the cover back on the pillow wasn't too difficult. I didn't give it 5 stars because it is on the small side for the price and quality and it came in a torn package so the cover was dirty on arrival.
customer_reviews.author: Walker

customer_reviews.title: Not as comfortable as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: The pillow does offer some comfort, but not enough to justify the purchase. I use it only occasionally, since there are various problems with it. The pillow case is not very smooth, so to my pregnant skin it often seems too itchy and does make me sweat on hotter summer days. A longer pillow would have been more comfortable but it would also take up a lot more space. Also, the pillow itself is really stiff, so at times when I want it to mold to my body I end up being very frustrated. So back to my regular pillows I go.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Leahy

customer_reviews.title: Great support, perfect size.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for a couple of months now to relieve hip pain during third trimester. It has provided instant relief and helps me sleep through the night. I am 5’3” and didn’t want a huge pillow— I sleep with husband and dog, plus I like my normal head pillow and didnt want to use something different under my head. This snoogle is the perfect solution. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ximena

customer_reviews.title: I love the support
customer_reviews.text: I love the back and side support, I am a side sleeper. If it's firmness holds up I hope it will be my favorite pillow for years to come, it will make it worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Meiferdt

customer_reviews.title: Too Short.
customer_reviews.text: This pillow would be so much better if it were 3-4" longer. I know its supposed to be mini, but it is just barely too small for comfort and I feel like its giving me a wedgie if I move while I'm sleeping. I am 5'-7" which i feel is pretty average and this just doesn't fit my body. We recently got a puppy and she has taken over this pillow as her bed, so at least it is being used.
customer_reviews.author: Tikki Aladora

customer_reviews.title: Just ok.
customer_reviews.text: I'm petite so I thought this would suit me better than the full sized snoogle, but i think I was wrong because this one is awkward to get comfortable with, feels too short and I'm only 5'2. The cover is also very scratchy and I can't find a jersey one for the mini ANYWHERE, so I wish I'd just gotten the big one.
customer_reviews.author: Kayley Hannon

customer_reviews.title: a must-have in pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: This was the best thing I invested in during my pregnancy. I got it when I was 4 months because I needed a pillow between my legs. Later on in my pregnancy I was diagnosed with symphysis pubis dysfunction (separation of the pubic bone) and this was a life saver! I was hoping to use it with me baby too as a boppy pillow but its hard to use it for nursing. i will try to use it to make her sit when she gets a little bit bigger. One thing that bothered me was that the pillow would become flat after a while and would have to be adjusted. other than that I loved it!
customer_reviews.author: emaregemini

customer_reviews.title: Great pregnancy pillow!
customer_reviews.text: I chose this pillow because it was smaller and less expensive. After reading the reviews, I also liked that fact that I could sleep with my own pillow and this would become the "body" pillow. In my opinion, it helps those of us who are stomach sleepers transition to sleeping on the side as well as keeping the hips aligned for less discomfort. I'm fairly short, 5'4", so it seems to fit me quite well and something to keep in mind. I like that it's not very bulky and doesn't take up a large amount of space in bed. Great alternative to the big pregnancy pillows, plus it's helped my sleep thus far!
customer_reviews.author: B. Cuenin

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: I used this pillow in many ways. Sleeping positions were ok, it was hard to flip on my sides because I had to flip the pillow in the middle of the night. Other than that I also used it for back support and breast feeding the baby. It still came in handy for many things. Husband might steal after I am done with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chaco.

customer_reviews.title: otherwise the perfect size for my queen bed without taking over the ...
customer_reviews.text: wish the firmness would have held up longer. I am just about due and got it several months ago but it has creases where my legs lay on it, and i have to constantly re fluff.. otherwise the perfect size for my queen bed without taking over the entire bed!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael W.

customer_reviews.title: Sleep pillow no, nursing pillow yes.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this, to help me sleep but not take up too much space on my queen size bed, but I just can't make it work. Not to say it won't work for someone else, but I have tried all sorts of positions and used extra pillows but the bends in the pillow are so tight and not very forgiving I can't get passed it with my sensory issues. Also the cover is a pain to get on and off, it would be nice if they could make a better cover sold separately. I give it 2 stars because I think it will work well as a nursing pillow.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waist Your Money, Just Use Pillows
customer_reviews.text: "You've got to have a pregnancy pillow" all the online blogs and whatnot said. I am currently 20 weeks pregnant with my first baby and found this pillow to simply be too thick for me. I learned from this product that I can't have pillows between my knees without having hip pain (I need to put pillows between my calves instead). I wish I would've saved the money and just used the pillows that I am currently using. This pillow is now just sitting in my closet and I'm hoping to find another use for it...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: im petite 4'11 and thought this would be better for me than the standard snoogle but after using ...
customer_reviews.text: im petite 4'11 and thought this would be better for me than the standard snoogle but after using it for a week or two i gave up.. it really was not large enough for me to be able to put between my legs which is one of the main things i wanted out of a pregnancy pillow
customer_reviews.author: Tanya D

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Worse night sleep too small of a pillow I am 5"2 and this pillow barely went from my crotch to my boobs. I know it said mini but really this is child sized, other pillows I have tried are usually too big this one was too small like it was designed for a child. I couldn't get in to any of the positions the pillow advertises I would not recommend this unless you happen to be a little person as anyone over 5foot would not be comfortable with this item
customer_reviews.author: Tikka 6669

customer_reviews.title: Not firm/supportive for body
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in the pillow. I mainly wanted support for between my legs and possibly keep me from rolling on my back, so I thought this size would be perfect. It’s not very firm at all, and I only lasted for an hour before it bothered me enough to give up. I’ll be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: mck4517

customer_reviews.title: Like it, don't love it
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love my mini snoogle. And I do like it, but it didn't quite live up to my expectations. I still have a hard time finding a comfortable position with it, and I've had it for almost 2 months. My husband loves it and its small size, and he often tries to steal it in the middle of the night. I plan to buy another body pillow to use in addition to my mini snoogle to help me get comfy, much to my husband's dismay.
customer_reviews.author: JerraTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Pregnancy Must!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pillow in the beginning of my 2nd trimester. I was a little hesitant if I would even need a pillow like this, but I'm so glad I got this because it became a must-have item for me! I did a lot of research before buying and settled on this one because it wasn't overly big. I'm petite so I didn't want a gigantic pregnancy pillow and I didn't want it taking up space in our bed. By my 3rd trimester I was in love with this thing...I would literally sigh each night when I snuggled up with this in bed. This pillow kept me comfy and sleeping sound...priceless for achy pregnant lady!
customer_reviews.author: sarah212

customer_reviews.title: Compact Pillow - Variety of Uses
customer_reviews.text: I love this pillow! It's the size of two nursing pillows so it is not overly large and will not take over your bed. I use it when I want to sleep on my stomach. I turn the two outside pieces in and make a circle, then I put it around my pregnant belly like an inner tube and lay down on my stomach. I use it on my side as well and I plan to use it as a nursing pillow after the baby arrives. Very soft and comfortable, but also holds up to my body weight. Definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Teach

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: Any pregnant woman who can afford to buy one should get it. I had so much trouble falling asleep even from my first trimester. After buying this the tossing and turning is reduced to a minimum and it indeed helps with back pain and neck alignment. Here's my advice, try not to wash the cover too often because it's a pain to put on and take off, and if you're taller than 5"2(I'm 5"2) you might want to buy the regular size and not this.
customer_reviews.author: Sakura x JuriTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Too small to fit a normal sized woman
customer_reviews.text: This pillow sucks. It's way too small. Sure it says mini, but the picture shows a woman actually fitting in the pillow. The pillow is too short to do what it's actually supposed to do. I got this pillow about a year ago, give or take a few months, got frustrated with it and put it in storage. Pulled it back out now that I'm pregnant and completely hate it. What a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: I'm 5'9 and 8 months pregnant it makes me feel like a fairy tale giant
customer_reviews.text: Certainly mini! I'm 5'9 and 8 months pregnant it makes me feel like a fairy tale giant, the only reason I'm keeping it is because my 2 year old likes to act like its a birds nest. Might work for someone who is about 5 feet tall, for anybody taller than that I would get the regular Leachco Snoogle. I had one with my first pregnancy and it was HEAVEN!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin F.

customer_reviews.title: not the answer, sadly
customer_reviews.text: Well, I returned this. I know people love the Snoogle but it didn't do it for me. I tried everything but never could figure out how to snuggle up in this thing, and it was huge and bulky in our queen sized bed even though I selected the mini version for space reasons. If it works for you, I'm jealous, because I never did find a great pregnancy sleeping solution, but this definitely wasn't the answer.
customer_reviews.author: funky cold medina

customer_reviews.title: great product! great price! used it through my pregnancy & still using it today
customer_reviews.text: ive had this for 13 months now & love it. so does my beautiful ladybaby! im 5'5 & had incredible hip & back pain throughout my entire pregnancy. it was just thick enough to balance my body & not too thick where my hips were spread too much like an ordinary body pillow. plus i could still use my normal pillow for my head since it was smaller. great product! great price! between the comfort it provided during my pregnancy, the helpful wrapping & propping it did while i was nursing & the comfort it has given my daughter (it doubles as a baby balancer.) i would give it a 6 star rating if i could.
customer_reviews.author: alli

customer_reviews.title: The Best Maternity Pillow EVER
customer_reviews.text: The Best Maternity Pillow EVER! It definitely was a perfect fit. You can wrap it around yourself, or use it for back support or even stretch it out to work as a body pillow. It was even loved by a toddler who wrap themselves around it, and worked great for nap time routines. I thought the material would have been a little on the soft side, but it definitely was rather firm. Even had a little pocket for a phone or a remote control on the side.
customer_reviews.author: Leslye Medina

customer_reviews.title: Buy the bigger one
customer_reviews.text: Spend more and buy the full size snoogle. I thought this was good enough bc I'm short (5'1") but it was not enough. The bigger one is definitely better.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a pregnancy pillow that leaves room for my husband!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a pillow that was smaller than most of the other pregnancy pillows on the market, so that I could still use my regular pillow for my head. This is exactly what I was looking for. It is small enough that I can easily turn from one side to the other at night, and the curved hook keeps the pillow in the perfect place between my knees at night. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a pregnancy pillow that is not going to take up the entire bed.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Just okay.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a pillow that didn't cost an arm and a leg. Also I wanted to use my current pillow for my head so a smaller pregnancy pillow is ideal. This pillow meets those needs. What I don't particularly like about it is that it curves on both ends. Since it is smaller it would work more comfortably if only one end curved. I usually end up with one end of the pillow annoyingly curved into my neck/chest. It is weird and the way it's made you cannot just straighten the end out. Overall it works (sleeping is generally more comfortable) and it is a good price, but it is awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this size because I have a small house and I myself am petite so I thought it would be the best choice. It works as intended for me, however, I'm 5'2 and I just fit inside the pillow. If I were any taller I would be uncomfortable, so if you are I suggest the full size pillow. Fabric is not super soft but I am not bothered by it. I will say the most frustrating part is trying to flip over and switch sides in the middle of the night, but if I'm being truly honest it really has helped me sleep better for the most part.
customer_reviews.author: KirstenL

customer_reviews.title: Dual purpose- helpful during pregnancy and postpartum.
customer_reviews.text: It was helpful to have something different than just the pillows I was using. Now that the baby is here im finding this purchase even more helpful. I’m using it as a support pillow for breastfeeding which is great. It wraps around the front and also my back which I more than the boppy. I keep this in the bedroom so I don’t have to carry the boppy from living room to bedroom each night.
customer_reviews.author: Jen M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, particularly for reducing lower back pain!
customer_reviews.text: Starting at about 20 weeks of her pregnancy, my wife began experiencing lower back pain. After doing some research (and because she's only 5'0"), we decided to order this. It's only been 10 days, but her back pain has subsided. Just this morning she told me that this was the best thing we've purchased during her entire pregnancy. I will say that it did make sleeping in a queen size bed feel a little tight at first (for me, not for her), but I quickly got used to it.
customer_reviews.author: JK07

customer_reviews.title: And putting the pillow cover back on is no easy task!
customer_reviews.text: I think this pillow does the job for me in relieving some back pain I was feeling by helping to keep my legs apart. I loop it between my legs with the longer end by my back, and this helps me not roll completely on my back which I tend to do often. The problem I have with this pillow as other people have complained about is the stuffing. It goes completely flat after a few days. I had to put extra stuffing in it myself. It was a hassle. And putting the pillow cover back on is no easy task!
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Romero

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a pregnancy pillow that would fit in our queen sized bed comfortably... the Snoogle mini is the way to go! Four stars (and not five) for these two reasons: 1) the curly-que design is versatile, but sometimes feels a little tight if you would like to have it between the upper thighs (it seems to pinch a bit). 2) The fabric has pilled considerably after about a month of daily use. But, it's a nice, soft cotton with a good hand to it. I think one of those sweater-saver things will get the pilling off. It's not a deal-breaker by any means, as it's helping me sleep SO much better.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Good, up until 30 weeks
customer_reviews.text: This was a comfortable body pillow for early pregnancy. I took it on several trips and the smaller size was very convenient. However, around 30 weeks and a larger belly, it became too small, particularly in length. I am of average height and the regular, large sized Snoogle is much more comfortable now. I still use the mini as a back rest while sitting in bed and a back support while sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Anne G.

customer_reviews.title: Quality pillow, using to reduce snoring
customer_reviews.text: Quality of pillow is excellent: nice quality material, well stitched-good value for cost. Made in USA with US and imported materials. Sturdy, not too firm but not too soft-comfortable and attractive. My use of this pillow is different than intended-to help reduce snoring. The pillow has helped-not 100%-but this is not what it was made for. I've tried another anti-snoring pillow and this works way better because the longer portion fits behind my back, discouraging rolling over.
customer_reviews.author: Nan

customer_reviews.title: Good pillow for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pillow a month ago (at 7 months into my pregnancy) for extra back support. It took me two nights to figure out how to position the pillow so that it would be the most comfortable. I have the bigger circular part at my head (with a soft pillow on top) and the long part at my back. I do wish it was longer on both sides for belly support as well,but for the price it was worth it. I already use a memory foam knee pillow anyway, so I didn't really care about that part. The pillow has still held it's firmness and seems to be of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Maile Pulsipher

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't matter if you are pregnant!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pillow to help keep my hips aligned while I sleep, also I am over weight and thought it could help support me better. It is amazing and so adjustable. The great great thing about this pillow we recently discovered on a car trip when my fiancé and I discovered how perfect it was to provide the perfect support for sleeping in a car, it supports you in all the weird ways ou need to be when traveling! I would have given it 5 stars if the outside fabric had been better quality and softer but other than that WOW
customer_reviews.author: J. Lampe

customer_reviews.title: Great for me while pregnant, great for the dogs now
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is amazing! It saved me during my pregnancy and immediately afterwords as well. It is very easy to snuggle My only complaint is that you sometimes had to try to move the stuffing around because it would get flat where it goes between your legs and fill up too much where your stomach was. Still I could not imagine getting through my pregnancy without this! Post pregnancy - the dogs love to use it as a snuggle friend.
customer_reviews.author: Bootlover

customer_reviews.title: Way too small for 3rd trimester
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5 foot even and I bought the mini snoogle because the regular size seemed way too big for someone so petite. At first the pillow worked out well but as my stomach grew with my little one it got increasingly too small. The last trimester the mini snoogle was basically useless. I would suggest getting the regular sized snoogle.
customer_reviews.author: Winkysmh

customer_reviews.title: This is a decent pillow, however, it is ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent pillow, however, it is not made for tall people or people with long torsos. One of the recommended positions for the pillow in the literature says that when the C-curve is under your head, the rest of the pillow follows down the length of the back and curves under the hips, supporting the entire spine, but when in that position, the pillow does not even reach the small of my back. That being said, it doesn't take up too much room and it doubles as a nursing pillow.
customer_reviews.author: zabine b.

customer_reviews.title: Great to use in combination with your regular pillow.
customer_reviews.text: I tried the full-sized Snoogle, and it wasn't for me, mostly 'cause I didn't like the angle it put my head at. This is a great to use in combination with my regular pillow. I'm still adjusting to rolling over while I'm sleeping, but it's very nice to be able to prop my leg up and take some weight off my hips and pregnant belly. I'm looking forward to using it in some other ways - propping up my knees, using as a nursing pillow, etc.
customer_reviews.author: A. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Buy it Early in Pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: I have had this pillow a little under a week. I absolutely love it! I used to toss and turn every night to try to shift all the extra weight off of my hips. I position the pillow to support heavier breasts, stomach, and to provide back/hip support. I waited until my third trimester to buy one because I kept telling myself that I didn't need it and that it wouldn't be worth the money. I could have had a lot better sleep up until now
customer_reviews.author: FinanceMajor

customer_reviews.title: Helped hip pain
customer_reviews.text: If I could give 4.5 stars I would. This is the perfect size...I've been sleeping in a twin bed (divorce- had to move in with the rents) and I'm quite comfortable now. I leave it semi-coiled in between my legs so the entire length of my top leg is supported- from thigh to ankle. Using it this way has alleviated 90% of my pregnancy hip discomfort. The material is a bit rough but I'm so happy my hip pain is gone, I'm giving this 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Sheilah

customer_reviews.title: A good product for the right mom.
customer_reviews.text: A great idea, but not for every mom. This works great for my wife, but she is fairly short. If she were taller there is no way that this would have been able to do all of the things that it advertises. Also, it can be a bit bulky. That being said, it really came in handy during many of my wife's restless nights sleeping while pregnant and continue to be handy now that baby has arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for more back support. It works well in between my thighs for hip support. I wasn't looking for it to go under my head, which it wouldn't anyway. It's kind of a pain to flip over with in bed. I use this with a belly wedge but I still can't sleep through the night and end up leaning too much onto my belly. If I had the money I'd invest in one of those awesome supports that prenatal masseuses have. Maybe a larger one of these would have been better for back support but I have no way of knowing.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Useful during and post pregnancy!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pillow! I'm 5'1" and carried twins to 37 weeks.. I would've been miserable without this pillow. Since I'm short, the mini snoogle was able to be tucked under my head and curve under my belly and go between my legs. Now that my twins are here, they only sleep comfortably in the snoogle! I take turns putting them down for naps in it. I have also used it to breast feed.. I also have a boppy and a Brest friend nursing pillow, but I prefer the snoogle to nurse. It held its shape well after I slept on it for about 6 months during the pregnancy.
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: Finally Sleep
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pillow in my 2nd trimester because pain in my hips was keeping me awake for hours every night. Since using the Snoogle Mini, my hip pain has been significantly reduced during the few nights it has returned; the rest of the time I have been pain-free. I am 5'7" and the pillow (barely) fits under my head and between my knees at the same time. I have not had a hard time getting the pillow case on and off as some reviewers have stated--I do let the pillowcase air dry, not sure if that makes a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sized pillow for sleeping and feeding
customer_reviews.text: I love this pillow! It really helped me sleep better during pregnancy. I would bring it back and forth from the couch to the bed so I could relax in comfort. I also used it a lot for breastfeeding, and it was great to have that extra support behind my head and I liked how it wrapped around more than the boppy. It's a great size... I don't think my husband would have been as tolerant of the bigger pillows, but this one was just right!
customer_reviews.author: apm210

customer_reviews.title: I personally was super disappointed with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I personally was super disappointed with this purchase. The pillow size was to small for me to comfortably have it between my legs and under my neck and I am only 5'4". The other problem is that there is to thick of cushioning. When trying to lay on my side my neck hurt when I woke up because of the awkward angle it had been at all night. I will be returning this pillow hopefully. Not comfy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly green

customer_reviews.title: This snoogie is pretty great. I use it for sitting on the ...
customer_reviews.text: This snoogie is pretty great. I use it for sitting on the couch or bed, and it makes it so much more comfortable! The only reason I didn't leave 5 stars was because I can't sleep with it: It is difficult to flip over onto my other side with it in bed, and it also doesn't provide belly support (not as well as my wedge pillow). But for lounging or napping, it is fabulous and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: skb

customer_reviews.title: Nice small pillow, but ended up returning it for large pillow
customer_reviews.text: Nice pillow, but I ended up returning it for the larger version. This pillow was the perfect density and was very nice - but I knew right away that it was not going to quite cut it for me. I am 5'7" and when I bought this I was in my second trimester. I just knew that the full (dual sided) Leachco Snoogle was going to be a better fit for me, despite its size. If you are more petite or normally not much of a pillow user, this is probably a nice option.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bernardi

customer_reviews.title: Must have early in pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: I love this snuggle mini I bought it early in my pregnancy and I was glad because I have slept so much better with it. It really is for someone that wants to support their back and belly because it is not long enough to use for under the head as well. I like that it does not take up the same amount of space as the large one.
customer_reviews.author: Aurora

customer_reviews.title: Takes some getting used to.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this pillow does what it needs to, supports my belly and helps my back by keeping my legs supported. The only issue is it's very hard to roll over and I can't spend an entire night in one position. I've figure out how to maneuver around the pillow, but it's taken some time and quite a few nights of it ending up on the floor half way through. I'm about 23 weeks in and so not super big yet and am not sure how well it will hold up, but for right now, it works just fine and doesn't take up the entire bed like the full body sized ones do.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Great maternity pillow for petite women
customer_reviews.text: NOT FOR MOMMIES MORE THEN 5 FEET TALL. Il 4'11 and in my 2nd trimester. This pillow is a mini, not an average maternity pillow size but for me it works really well. It fits right to my size and im able to relieve the pain from my hip when sleeping. Its not flat at all and has a good amount of stuffing it in to keep its shape. I plan on using this pillow for when the baby is born during feedings as well.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: I liked it for the most part but there were a ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this when I was in my 2nd trimester of pregnancy. I liked it for the most part but there were a few things that I didn't love. First of all, it did get flat or loose its fluff in done spots after a few weeks of use. Secondly, it was pretty difficult to maneuver if you switch sides when sleeping like I do. It did the job though and I use it on occasion even after my baby was born.
customer_reviews.author: HNshops

customer_reviews.title: Not enough support
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking that the snoogie would be a solution to my back and hip pains while I was pregnant, but it was way too small length wise for me. I felt very cramped. I wound up just using a regular body pillow and that worked just fine. I wouldn't use the top part as your pillow, too small and not enough support. The cushion part between my legs didn't help either, made my hips feel worse. I was disappointed after reading such great reviews on it.
customer_reviews.author: Hannahlynnemt

customer_reviews.title: Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is great! I can't sleep without it. I'm pregnant with twins and this pillow gives me comfort throughout the night. I'm 5'2 and it fits perfectly for me. Supports my back and belly. Soft material against my skin. We have a queen size bed and my husband has no complaints. I would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Nina Silva

customer_reviews.title: Great Compact Pregancy Pillow
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this when I was about 13 weeks pregnant with my first child and was having terrible hip pain and unable to sleep at night. This has been a great pillow - it is small and easily moldable to your body which has made lying on me side and semi-sleeping on my back (great back support pillow at night) so much more tolerable. Since it is smaller than other pillows, it doesn't take up too much room in my husband's and my queen size bed. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: classicaljess

customer_reviews.title: Wanted so much to love this....
customer_reviews.text: I just couldn't make it work. I tried and tried to find a way to sleep with this, using my own pillow for my head, using this pillow for my haead while the rest of it wrapped around me....so many ways I tried. I just couldn't get comfy with it. If you have prime and get free returns then go for it and give it a shot, but otherwise I'd probably stay away. I felt like if it didn't curl there at the bottom that it would have been much better!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: I hate it. :(
customer_reviews.text: I hate this thing. I heard great reviews so I bought it hiping itd help with my discomfort. I'm 5'2 and 140lbs (7 months pregnant.) I don't know how ANYONE finds a comfortable position with this thing. It's super firm and not flexible at all. My body just doesn't fit in it. I want to return it but already threw the packaging out like an idiot, so I guess I have a $50 cat bed. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Not for me...
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it is the size or firmness, but I was not happy with this purchase. I am about 5'6" and this pillow does not fit comfortably in any position for me. I am a little over 7 months pregnant and the firmness of the pillow does not allow for my belly to rest comfortable on it or against it. I find myself rolling over a lot at night and this pillow does not allow for easy movement either. I have gone back to using a head pillow between my legs and a wedge for my belly. So far this combination has been the move comfortabel and manageable.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa H.

customer_reviews.title: Longevity of this product is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife so she could be more comfortable while she was pregnant with twins! Lol. This is a great product! Even after the twins were born we still used this pillow to lay them in and now they are almost 4 months and we still use this pillow to lay one of them in. Works great and STILL works great! I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: FubarDraco

customer_reviews.title: Love this pillow
customer_reviews.text: Most wondeful pillow ive ever had i am only about 5'1 and this pillow is perfect size i love the way it hugs my body at first i thought it was a weird curve but its pretty great i use it when i sleep on my side and also use it like one of those baby pillows to sit up and read or watch tv.. i catch my boyfriend trying to cuddle with it most mornings too
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pregnant women that want comfortable sleep!
customer_reviews.text: I am in my third trimester, and I have used the Snoogle since my first trimester. The Snoogle has been a life saver. It gives me the belly or back support I need so I can get comfortable and fall asleep fast. The mini is the perfect size because it allows me to use my own pillow for head support. Some nights I feel like I'm wrestling an alligator, but I'm sure glad I have it. My Pomeranian even loves the Snoogle. If I kick it to the side at night, I wake up to find my little pup Snooglin'. :-)
customer_reviews.author: caceewalker

customer_reviews.title: Looking for true comfort and support body. Then stop looking this is it LEACH. CO
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE MY SNOOGIES, This one I was so excited it came so quick. I am loving how I can have this versitle twisty pillow to prop myself up. This the only brand of pillow to purchase Its just awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Laura king

customer_reviews.title: I love my Snoogle mini
customer_reviews.text: I love my Snoogle mini! Helps me sleep during these rough months of pregnancy. I originally ordered the regular sized Snoogle which took up most of our bed. The mini is a much better size and allows for me to still use my tempurpedic neck pillow. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny M

customer_reviews.title: So worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. I was a little skeptical at first - I mean, how can a pillow really help that much? I am 7 months pregnant and my hips have been achy and sore in the mornings. Regular pillows stuffed all around my belly were just not helping. Using Leachco Snoogle Mini has made my nights so much more restful. I tuck the larger, more curved end between my knees, run it up along my belly and tuck it under my side just below the arm pit. Amazing! Turning over in the night is still a chore, but I wake up rested and comfortable! Totally worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Jo Ponder

customer_reviews.title: Can't sleep without it!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a side sleeper and really needed support on my lower back when sleeping. This pillow is fabulous! It comes with examples (and pictures!) of different ways to sleep with it based on your needs. I have used it every night and will continue to throughout the duration of my pregnancy. It also folds up nicely to act as a boppy for breastfeeding eventually. I would highly recommend this pillow!
customer_reviews.author: Deidre Schmalz

customer_reviews.title: great pillow, good for pregnany, sleeping, and nursing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pillow 7 months pregant because i was needing a body pillow but figured this would serve two purposes and could be used later for nursing as well. I have been usimg this pillow constantly, sittin on the couch and sleeping, its amazing! It is not a full size body pillow so it doesn't take up the whole bed, i have been using a regular pillow between my legs and this for back and neck. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Loved this pillow during my pregnancy.
customer_reviews.text: This pillow was a lifesaver during my pregnancy (and now during my post-partum time, I haven't been able to let it go). I'm 5' 1 1/4" and it fits my body, but it's a close fit. If I were even a tiny bit taller, it wouldn't work. Even though it did fit me, it stretched a bit far from my body so there wasn't a whole lot of support for my pregnancy belly. The only major flaw is the difficulty of maneuvering the slip cover. This should be made like a boppy pillow slip cover with a zipper down the side, or better yet, over a seam. The current design is a pain in the behind.
customer_reviews.author: Luajoy

customer_reviews.title: A must have during pregnancy! !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I was 5 months pregnant best purchase I ever made! I liked this style better than a full body pillow because I usually have to sleep with 2 pillows if not I wake up with a sinus headache. It provides good back and belly support especially when your closer to delivering. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Lilia

customer_reviews.title: Good pregnancy pillow
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a pillow that I could still use my own pillow for my head yet give me the support between my knees and back, this fits those needs. I'm just starting my 2nd trimester and I love snuggling up with this on the couch, it will be great for the remainder of my pregnancy. I also like that it doesn't take up the entire bed so there is still room for husband and the dog! I'm barely 5'3" and this pillow is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: This pillow helps support my growing bump, and also ...
customer_reviews.text: This pillow helps support my growing bump, and also provides neck support. However, you need a pillow to adequately prop up your head or else you can get shoulder cramps. I am 5'1 and petite built and cannot use this on its own without another pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Mathew

customer_reviews.title: Decent smaller maternity pillow.
customer_reviews.text: I bought thus because it is a maternity pillow at a reasonable price. It has been very helpful without being too bulk. However, I would not recommend to anyone over 5'3". I am taller, about 5'8" and it is too small to be used as I would like. I do like it for propping up when I have acid reflux and to lay on my belly once in awhile.
customer_reviews.author: RE Monreal

customer_reviews.title: Helps me at night!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this smaller version because I share a queen with my boyfriend. I didn't want to be totally selfish and take up the whole bed with this pillow. Even though it is smaller, it does the trick! It helps me fall asleep and stay asleep until those late night bathrrom breaks, of course! You can even use this as a nursing pillow once the baby is born. The cover easily comes off so that it can be washed.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Pfaff

customer_reviews.title: Leaves room for everyone!
customer_reviews.text: After reading many reviews for various pregnancy pillows my wife and I opted for the mini snoogle and were not disappointed! It does it's job while leaving room for me in the bed. My wife has been very happy with the extra support it provides but don't expect a miracle cure for pregnancy discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: jmnixonexp

customer_reviews.title: Too short...
customer_reviews.text: Pillow was too short, but I think it would have been great if I had a shorter torso. I'm 5'7'' with a long torso/short legs, I didn't want to use it as a pillow for my head, so thought it would be perfect. I have bad shoulders and planned to tuck one end between my legs and the other under my armpit to take weight off of my shoulder. When I had it between my legs, though, the top hit my rib cage very uncomfortably. As it was, I was about a foot too long to use it comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Two pregnant ladies give this a thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this item two times for two pregnant ladies. One said that she had tried other body pillows but they were too bulky. Both ladies said this one is a perfect fit and they appreciated how much comfort it gave them as their babies grew. (My son in law has been known to sneak it when he takes a nap).
customer_reviews.author: M. Henry

customer_reviews.title: this is not as comfortable as before
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought a body pillow this was my savior.. but as my tummy grows, this is not as comfortable as before. I still use this every night when I go to bed. I am glad I purchased this though, coz this is multi-purpose. I can use this as a feeding pillow when my baby arrives. The price is reasonable. Overall, it's still a good buy. I guess I'm just more comfortable using my body pillow nowadays.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Not just for preggos!
customer_reviews.text: No more knee pain! Purchased for my husband who likes to have pillows between his legs when he sleeps and this does the trick! Its long so he can move around and it still stays in place. It's also nice to just snuggle with or if you need added support in any position because it contours to you whim. I would recommend this over a traditional rectangle body pillow.
customer_reviews.author: CLN

customer_reviews.title: Beware it is small
customer_reviews.text: Super small. I am 5'0" and cannot fins a comfortable position to use this pillow. It pulls on my neck and it doesn't stay put. I wake up constantly to fix it. I cannot return it, because my husband removed the tags. He got it for me as a surprise gift. Too small!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Frnk

customer_reviews.title: Good for a minute
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in my second trimester to easily the common aches of pregnancy. It was great at first but quickly became too flat for my liking. I even attempted to add more stuffing to help poof it back up. This was the perfect size for me (I debated getting the standard size) since I am a petite woman (5'0). It's ok, but can't say I'd buy this product in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: This pillow wasn't big enough to satisfy my comfort. But it works well when I just roll it up and stick it between my legs. Although you can't really conform it to your body by placing it under your head AND between your legs. The title really says it all when it states that it is "Mini Compact". I'd say to go the extra mile and get a decent sized one because your comfort and rest are worth it, even if it costs more.
customer_reviews.author: S. Najera

customer_reviews.title: Great size, price & versatile!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Wish it was a tad bit taller but overall perfect for every stage of preganancy and not too overbearing to take up too much space in bed. It's also very versatile to be able to support you sitting not just for moms but kiddos too!
customer_reviews.author: socalphilly

customer_reviews.title: Give it time
customer_reviews.text: Hated it at first but love it now the case is hard to get off to wash and even harder to put on
customer_reviews.author: tailgator

customer_reviews.title: Love it after getting used to it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I didn't think a full size would fit on our queen bed. I am 26 weeks pregnant and this pillow really helps me sleep comfortably on my side. That said, it took me over a month get used to it and figure out the best positions for me. Now that I figured it out (or maybe I'm just finally big enough to utilize it properly), I love it. But it did take quite a while to get there. Just be patient and creative.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I didn't know what products would work best. I ordered this snoogle because I am a ...
customer_reviews.text: As a first time mom, I didn't know what products would work best. I ordered this snoogle because I am a smaller woman and I didn't want this to take up the whole bed! When I sleep I switch sides a lot and move around- so everytime I would switch the side I was laying on, I would have to get out of bed to reposition the pillow. Just didn't work well for me.
customer_reviews.author: B&E Worthington

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: This pillow has definitely helped relieve my hip pain while trying to sleep at night during my pregnancy! I like that it is smaller and that I can use my usual pillow for under my head, versus the full-body size pillows! I also love that the pillow is firm, but still soft. I share a king size bed with my husband and large dog and this pillow does not get in the way of anyone's space. Whenever I roll over onto my back, my dog curls up in this pillow...I think she enjoys it as much as I do! :)
customer_reviews.author: Christie
